body.p:
State of Kentucky
Rockcastle County sct
To His Excellency
Governor Bramlett
Frankfort
Your Petitioner Stephen T Bryant would respectfully Represent

That at the February Term of the Rockcastle circuit Court 1865, a Judgment was rendered against him for Sixty dollars fine. upon an inditement found against him in said court, charged with Keeping a tipling house

Your Petitioner would humbly state the circumstance of the case as follows. on the day of -- 1863 he happened into McClanseys Grocery in MtVernon. the grocery Keeper happened not to be present he was asked if any thing was Kept there to drink, upon the inquiry he steped round the Counter and sot anon a Bottle, out of which a dram was taken, for which your petitioner was find the above named sum, and Judgment rendered accordingly and execution upon said Judgment is now pressing him, and unless releived will have the fine to pay, he further states that he is a poor man and unable to pay said fine: The Judgment is appressive, that he committed the act, not Knowing he had violated the law in any particular, he therefore humbly askes the interposition of your Excellency, and remit the fine or so much thereof as is due the state -- and as in duty bound will ever pray &c -- Given under my hand
this 6th day of aprile 1865
Sworn to and subscribed before me by Stephen T Bryant on the day and date above mentioned
A Smith c R c c

We the undersigned citizens of MtVernon Rockcastle County Ky state that we believe the statement made by the Petitioner Stephen T Bryant is true, and we think it Just and right the fine should be remitted.

W. A. Brooks
F B McClary
James G Carter
Alfred Smith C R c c

Rockcastle Cir Ct
vs
Stephen F. Bryant
$60 --
Remitted
8th April/65
